content: 4. Oklahoma Laws concerning the 10 Commandments, illegal aliens, firearms and state sovereignty- Truth! [url="http://www.truthorfiction.com"/]"http://www.truthorfiction.com"/*[/url] rumors/ o/ oklahoma-laws.htm cache ====================================== The state law passed today, 37 to 9, had a few liberals in the mix, an amendment to place the Ten Commandments on the front entrance to the state capitol. The Feds in D.C., along with the ACLU, said it would be a mistake. Hey, this is a conservative state, based on Christian values...! Guess what...We did it anyway. We recently passed a law in the state to incarcerate all illegal immigrants, and ship them back to where they came from unless they want to get a green card and become an American citizen. They all scattered. Hope we didn't send any of them to your state. This was against the advice of the Federal Government, and the ACLU. They said it would be a mistake. Guess what.....we did it anyway. Yesterday, we passed a law to include DNA samples from any and all illegals to the Oklahoma database for criminal investigative purposes. Pelosi said it was unconstitutional. Guess what.....We did it anyway. Several weeks ago, we passed a law declaring Oklahoma as a Sovereign state, not under the Federal Government directives. That makes Oklahoma and Texas the only states to do so. Guess what.....More states are likely to follow. Louisiana, Alabama, Georgia, both Carolina's, Tennessee, Kentucky, Missouri, Arkansas, West Virginia, just to name a few. Should Mississippi act, so will Florida. Save your confederate money. It appears the South is about to rise up once again. The Federal Government has made bold steps to take away our guns. Oklahoma, a week ago, passed a law confirming people in this state have the right to bear arms and transport them in their vehicles. I'm sure that was a set back for the Kennedys and Ms. Pelosi. Guess what.....We did it anyway. By the way, Obama does not like any of this. Guess what....we don't care....we're doing it anyway. GET YOUR STATE TO FOLLOW..Don't let the Federal Government walk on you. SEABEE'S "CAN DO", "HAVE DONE", AND WILL DO SO FOREVER. GOD BLESS AMERICA

content: ... ...They, (the anti gun mental midgets) are trying to screw with the legal sportsmen, and women up here by an ammo bill that makes everyone who purchases ammo waste time, and they collect more info,... ...Not going to fly here, NY makes the legal beagle jump through more hoops the Joey Chitwood already, and there was a strong support rejecting it yesterday,... ... Strong opposition to proposal to register ammo; 200 attend ...In the local paper,"Times Union" Albany NY ALBANY — Some 200 people jammed into the County Legislature chambers Tuesday night, nearly all to send a message to legislators that a proposed law requiring gun shops to register ammunition sales won't stop crime but could halt re-election bids. Mobile AlertsGet weather alerts, sports scores and more. "The people of your towns, villages and cities are fed up with politics as usual, taxes and politicians who don't listen ...," said Tom King, president of the New York State Rifle and Pistol Association and an NRA board member, to thunderous applause. "Thank you for pushing a ludicrous gun control issue that has finally helped me rally gun owners." King estimated there are "35,000 voters in this county who are motivated gun owners." Local Law A is one of the most controversial pieces of legislation to come before the 39-member legislature in some time. All but a handful of the nearly 50 speakers at the public hearing turned a thumbs down on the measure. No action was taken on the proposal which is before the legislature's Law Committee and will be voted out of committee before the June 8 meeting of the full body. Introduced at the March meeting the law would regulate the storage, possession and sale of ammunition and require dealers to record each ammo sale and the caliber, make and model of the firearm for which the ammo purchase was made. Wanda Willingham, an Albany Democrat and one of the sponsors said before the hearing, that the law would be "a start in regards to saving lives." Other states have similar laws on ammunition licensing, she said. "We finally stood up and got the nerve to move forward on an issue that affects many communities, and we finally caught up with the rest of the nation," Willingham said. Democrats Phillip Steck of Colonie and Douglas Bullock of Albany are also sponsors. Steck said the measure is an "effort to enforce an existing law and make sure it's complied with," referring to a state law governing ammunition sales. Before the hearing, protestors walked with signs in front of the Albany County Courthouse where the legislature chambers are, but they were not allowed to carry the signs into the courthouse. At the hearing were Albany Common Council President Shawn Morris and Council member Barbara Smith. Thomas Chandler of Guilderland accused legislators of using the law as a "cheap way to exploit bigotry ... and stereotypes against the Second Amendment community." Bill Hart of Troy called it a feel-good law. "It's as effective in stopping crime as a stop watch is in stopping time." Roger Barchitta of Colonie said it's "back door registration. This is not solely about handgun ammunition. It's about ammunition for all different types of weapons."

content: "Most controlling President evahh!!!" Actually, that would be either Lincoln or FDR, mainly due to the emergency powers granted by Congress. In the modern era? Nixon, surprisingly enough - it was his administration that flexed the Executive power the most in recent years - the detachment from the gold standard, wage and price controls, and regulation of industry. The rest of your rant is just baseless fear mongering. Trying to rouse the idiot mouthbreathers who, like you, haven't thought out current events beyond what they hear on the evening news or partisan radio. Granted, I didn't vote for Obama, don't really know if I like the guy, and have NEVER supported the Democratic Party since Carter, but I can still recognize 'rable rousing' rants when I see them. You are doing it now. Grow up. Read a book on Constitutional and/or Administrative Law and learn the process by which the Executive branch works BY LAW UNDER THE CONSTITUTION. It's expected of you as a citizen. Sullivan013

We recently passed a law in the state to incarcerate all illegal immigrants, and ship them back to where they came from unless they want to get a green card and become an American citizen. They all scattered. Hope we didn't send any of them to your state. This was against the advice of the Federal Government, and the ACLU. They said it would be a mistake. Guess what.....we did it anyway. Yesterday, we passed a law to include DNA samples from any and all illegals to the Oklahoma database for criminal investigative purposes. Pelosi said it was unconstitutional. Guess what.....We did it anyway. Several weeks ago, we passed a law declaring Oklahoma as a Sovereign state, not under the Federal Government directives. That makes Oklahoma and Texas the only states to do so. Guess what.....More states are likely to follow. Louisiana, Alabama, Georgia, both Carolina's, Tennessee, Kentucky, Missouri, Arkansas, West Virginia, just to name a few. Should Mississippi act, so will Florida. Save your confederate money. GET YOUR STATE TO FOLLOW..Don't let the Federal Government walk on you. What got lost somewhere in the mix is that the Constitution Was to regulate what the Federal Government could do, not the People.... About the only reach it was to have was to regulate actions between the States so that they would not create punitive trade laws against each other that might cause border disputes and civil war. The Constitution was NEVER supposed to reach into the States and force them to change or write laws on how they would govern themselves internally, beyond requiring them to have "Democratic Republican" forms of government. The 13th, 14th, and 15th Amendments were the first incursions into how States would write and enforce internal laws. No doubt slavery and it affects needs to be weeded out, but those three Amendments let the camal get his nose it the tent, and the Federal Government has been digging deeper and deeper into the States and into the individual lives of Americans - - Wandering and Wondering
